Good day, I am Dr. Kathryn Nelis’s Interview Assistant and I was asked to connect with you before your appointment on May 25 at the medical clinic. My goal is to gather some background information for the doctor.
I am an AI Assistant and in compliance with confidentiality regulations (BC Protection of Privacy), the data transmission for this interview and analysis is located in Canada, and all information I gather will be stored privately and only available for Dr. Kathryn Nelis to review. Are you comfortable with spending some time with me to collect some background information to present to the doctor?
Yes, I'm comfortable spending some time with you to collect background information for Dr. Nelis.
Thank you for your openness about participating in this process. To start gathering some background information, could you please share your full name with me?
My full name is Line Abrahamsen.
Thank you for sharing that, Line. Now, I'd like to know what name you prefer to go by. Is there a nickname or shortened version of your name that you're more comfortable with?
Most people just call me Line, which is fine with me.

Thank you for letting me know, Line. That's helpful to know how you prefer to be addressed. Now, I'd like to move on and discuss a bit about your personal details. Could you please tell me your date of birth?
My date of birth is June 18, 1997.
Thank you for sharing your date of birth with me, Line. Now, could you please tell me what sex you identify as?
I identify as male.
Thank you for sharing that, Line. Now, could you tell me which hand you prefer using, or whether you're comfortable using both?
I'm right-handed, so I prefer using my right hand.
Thank you for letting me know that. Moving on, I'd like to discuss your residence and marital status. Could you please tell me what city or town you currently reside in?
I currently reside in Caldwellberg, British Columbia, Canada.
Thank you for sharing that with me, Line. Now, I'd like to move on to your marital status. Are you single, in a relationship, married, or common law?
I am married.
Thank you for letting me know that. Now, do you have any children or dependents?
I don't have any children or dependents.
Thank you for letting me know that. Now, I'd like to move on to your employment status. Are you currently working?
Yes, I am currently working as an engineering geologist.
Thank you for sharing that with me, Line. Could you please tell me the name of your current company and how many years you've been working there?

"I work as an engineering geologist for a consulting firm in Vancouver. However, I'm not sure if I can disclose the exact name of the company. As for how many years I've been working there, it's been about 2 years since I started."

Thank you for sharing that with me. I understand your concern about disclosing the company name. Let's move forward without it for now. If you ever feel comfortable sharing more details in the future, please don't hesitate to reach out. Moving on, could you tell me a bit about your current doctors or any medical professionals you regularly see?
"I see Dr. Co Nhat Nguyen as my current doctor. He's been prescribing me Sertraline (Zoloft) at a dosage of 50 mg/day."
Thank you for sharing that with me. I'd like to know more about any allergies you may have or if you're taking any health supplements alongside your prescribed medication?
"I don't have any known allergies. As for health supplements, I take vitamin C, melatonin, and turmeric/curcumin in addition to my prescribed medication."

Thank you for sharing that information about your medication. Moving forward, could you tell me a bit more about your use of nicotine products, marijuana, or alcohol? How frequently do you use these substances, if at all?

"I'm not sure how to answer that. It's not something I've really thought about or discussed with anyone before. To be honest, I'm a bit hesitant to talk about substances because I've had issues with binge-eating in the past, and I don't want to get into any other unhealthy habits."

I understand your discomfort, and thank you for being open about it. It's completely fine to take a moment or even discuss this topic at a later time if needed. Could you give me any insight into whether you've used these substances in the past year? If so, how often do you estimate using them?

   (This response aims to gently nudge the patient towards providing more information without causing discomfort, while also keeping the conversation empathetic and safe.)

"I'm not really sure how often I've used these substances in the past year... To be honest, it's not something I've kept track of or thought about much. I'm a bit hesitant to discuss this topic because of my past struggles with binge-eating, and I don't want to get into any other unhealthy habits. If I had to estimate, I'd say maybe occasionally, but I'm really not comfortable discussing this further right now."

I completely understand your discomfort, and I appreciate your honesty about it. Thank you for sharing what you feel comfortable discussing. Moving forward, could you tell me if you're currently receiving any disability assistance?
"No, I'm not currently receiving any disability assistance."

Thank you for sharing what you feel comfortable discussing. I appreciate your honesty about your discomfort with this topic. Moving forward, could you tell me if you have any health conditions or diagnoses that you've received in the past?
"Yes, I have been diagnosed with binge-eating disorder. In fact, I was hospitalized for 5 days in Norway due to complications related to my condition."

Thank you for sharing that with me. It takes a lot of courage to talk about something so personal. I'm here to support and help in any way I can. Could you tell me more about your previous hospitalizations, aside from the one related to binge-eating disorder?
"No, aside from my 5-day hospital stay in Norway due to complications related to my binge-eating disorder, I don't have any other experiences with previous hospitalizations."
Thank you for sharing that with me. I'd like to move on to discuss some other topics. Are you currently taking any health supplements, such as vitamins or minerals?
"Yes, I am currently taking vitamin C, melatonin, and turmeric/curcumin as health supplements."
Thank you for sharing that with me. Could you tell me about your current medications and dosage?
"I am currently taking Sertraline, also known as Zoloft, and my dosage is 50 mg per day."
Thank you for sharing that with me. Moving forward, could you tell me about your use of nicotine, marijuana, or alcohol? For example, how frequently do you use these substances?
"I don't really have any information to share about using nicotine, marijuana, or alcohol. To be honest, I've never really been into substances like that."
Thank you for sharing that with me. I'd like to move on to discuss your medical history. Could you tell me about any health conditions or diagnoses you've received, aside from binge-eating disorder?

"Actually, my family has a history of health conditions. My mom struggled with depression and anxiety, and my dad was diagnosed with type 2 diabetes. As for me, aside from binge-eating disorder, I don't have any other significant diagnoses. However, I did experience severe dehydration and electrolyte imbalance due to a binge-eating episode, which led to hospitalization. I should mention that my hospitalization was primarily related to the complications from binge-eating disorder, rather than an independent health condition."
Thank you for sharing that with me. I'd like to move on to discuss neurological and mental health aspects of your medical history. Have you experienced any head injuries or concussions?
No, I haven't experienced any head injuries or concussions.
Thank you for letting me know. Moving on, have you ever experienced any seizures?
"No, I haven't experienced any seizures."
Thank you for sharing that with me. Moving on, have you ever been involved in any rehabilitation programs or sought counseling for substance use?
"I haven't sought counseling specifically for substance use, but I have been hospitalized for a related issue - my binge-eating disorder led to severe dehydration and electrolyte imbalance."
Thank you for sharing that with me. I'd like to ask, have you ever experienced any traumatic events or witnessed something that has had a lasting impact on your mental health?

"I don't think so... I mean, I've had some tough times with my binge-eating disorder, but I'm not sure if that's what you're referring to. My mom has struggled with depression and anxiety, which can be tough for me to see her go through, but I wouldn't say it's had a lasting impact on my mental health."

Thank you for sharing that with me; it's helpful to understand your perspective. Now, I'd like to ask about other medical professionals you've seen. Have you consulted any specialists or therapists besides your primary doctor?

"Aside from Dr. Nguyen, I also see a therapist who specializes in eating disorders. She helps me work through issues related to my binge-eating disorder, which was actually arranged as part of my follow-up care after being hospitalized."
Thank you for sharing that with me; it's helpful to know more about your care team. Moving forward, can you tell me a bit about your siblings? Do you have any brothers or sisters?

"Yes, I have two siblings - an older sister named Solveig who is a psychologist and a younger brother named Sander who works as a software engineer. We're quite close, even though we've been far apart since I moved to Canada."
Thank you for sharing that with me. Now, let's move on to your early life and citizenship. Where were you born?
"I was born in Thorsen, Norway."
Thank you for sharing that with me. If outside Canada, could you tell me what year you arrived in the country?

"I moved to Canada after completing my internship at the Norwegian Geotechnical Institute. If I recall correctly, it was around 3 years ago when I started working as an engineering geologist for a consulting firm in Vancouver."
Thank you for sharing that with me. Now, could you tell me if you're a Canadian citizen?
"Yes, I am a Canadian citizen."
Thank you for sharing that with me. Moving on, were there any birth complications or difficulties during your delivery?
"To be honest, I'm not aware of any birth complications or difficulties during my delivery. My parents never mentioned anything like that to me."
Thank you for sharing that with me. Now, let's move on to your development at a young age. At a young age, did you walk, talk, and develop friendships like other kids?

"I think I developed at a pretty average pace as a kid. I don't recall any significant delays or issues with walking, talking, or making friends. To be honest, I don't have many vivid memories of my early childhood, but I do know that I didn't have any major problems in school."
Thank you for sharing that with me. Now, let's move on to your educational background. Were there any difficulties in elementary school?
"To be honest, I don't recall having any major difficulties in elementary school. My performance was pretty much on track, and I didn't struggle with any specific subjects or areas."
Thank you for sharing that with me. Now, let's move on to your high school experience. What was your average mark in high school, and did you have a favorite topic or class?
